content:
The Reserve Bank of India on Friday announced that it would maintain the current repo rate, citing persistent inflationary pressures and global economic uncertainty. The decision was taken during the Monetary Policy Committee meeting after reviewing domestic growth indicators.

The central bank stated that while economic activity remains stable, rising food and fuel prices continue to pose risks to inflation targets. Officials reiterated their commitment to maintaining price stability while supporting sustainable economic growth.

Market analysts said the decision was largely expected and would help maintain liquidity in the banking system. The RBI also projected moderate GDP growth for the next financial year, depending on global trade conditions and investment trends.
